intro: Lachenalia roodeae, commonly known as the Roodea lachenalia, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to South Africa, specifically the Western Cape province, where it grows in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant produces vibrant, tubular flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in late winter to early spring. It is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its striking appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species.
